content.text:
# Manitoba Historical Society

The Manitoba Historical Society is a historical society in the province of Manitoba, Canada.  It was created in 1879 by an act of the Legislative Assembly of Manitoba, and describes itself as "the oldest organization in western Canada devoted to the promotion of public interest in, and preservation of, the regionâ€™s historical resources".  The society publishes a journal called Manitoba History and presents an annual literary award called the Margaret McWilliams Award. The current president of the society is Lawrence Prout CEO is Tracey Turner who is also curator of the Seven Oaks House Museum
Notable people
* William Kennedy, a founder
* H. Clare Pentland (President from 1963-65)
